question: What happens to the liquid in a capillary of insufficient length?
option1: liquid overflows from the upper end like a fountain
option2: liquid tickles along the vertical sides of the tube
option3: liquid does not rise at all
explanation: In case of capillary of insufficient length, the liquid will neither overflow from the upper end like a fountain nor will it tickle along the vertical sides of the tube. The liquid after reaching the upper end will increase the radius of its meniscus without changing nature.
